Key Match Events: France and Poland played to a 1-1 draw at the Euro 2024 match on June 25, 2024.
Kylian Mbapp√© scored a penalty goal for France in the 56th minute.
Adrien Rabiot scored a goal for France in the 43rd minute.
Robert Lewandowski scored a penalty goal for Poland in the 79th minute.
Jan Zalewski, Michal Probierz, Pawel Dawidowicz, and Szymon Swiderski were all given yellow cards in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Poland will be looking to extend an unwanted major tournament record held by France when they meet at Euro 2024 on Tuesday evening.
France have not won their final group-stage fixture in any tournament since beating Togo 2-0 at the 2006 World Cup.
France have not lost a single group game at a Euros under Didier Deschamps, a streak which has lasted eight matches.
France have not suffered a single defeat to Poland since 1982, a streak which has lasted eight contests.
